source_sentence: 佛說魔嬈亂經
translation: Sutra on the Conflict of Māra Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 失譯人名附後漢錄
translation: Lost the name of the translator appended to the Later Han Register

source_sentence: 聞如是：一時，婆伽婆在跋祇尸牧摩鼻量鹿野園中。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, Bhagavān was staying at the Deer Preserve of Vasiṣṭha’s Grove in Vṛjiputra’s Park.

source_sentence: 彼時，尊者大目乾連，為世尊作窟，時露地彷徉，教授令作。
translation: At the time, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana had made a cave for the Bhagavān, and he often wandered in the open air to teach and make it.

source_sentence: 彼時，魔波旬自化其身令微小，入尊者目乾連腹中。
translation: At the time, Māra Pāpīyān transformed himself to make his body small and entered the belly of Venerable Maudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 彼時目乾連，便作是念：「何以故？
translation: Maudgalyāyana then had this thought, Why is that?

source_sentence: 我腹便重，猶若食豆，我寧可如其像三昧正受，以三昧意，自觀己腹。」
translation: My belly becomes heavier, just like eating beans, so I'd better accept it as it is in samādhi and contemplate my own belly with the intention of samādhi.

source_sentence: 於是尊者大目乾連，離彷徉處，至經行，捶敷尼師壇，結跏趺坐。
translation: Venerable Mahā Moggallāna then departed from his place of wandering and went forth, sat cross-legged, set up a nun’s altar, and sat cross-legged.

source_sentence: 於是尊者大目乾連，即如其像三昧正受，以三昧意，自觀己腹。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then observed his own abdomen with the intention of samādhi.

source_sentence: 彼尊者大目乾連，即便知之，此魔波旬，入我腹中。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana knew it, and this Māra Pāpīyān entered my belly.

source_sentence: 於是尊者大目乾連，還從三昧起，告魔波旬曰：「汝波旬還出！
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana then rose from his samādhi and addressed Māra Pāpīyān, saying, Come back, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 汝波旬還出！
translation: You Pāpīyān, come back out!

source_sentence: 莫觸嬈如來及如來弟子，莫於長夜遭無量苦，無義饒益。」
translation: Don't touch the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciples, and don't experience measureless suffering for a long time; it doesn't make any sense to benefit them.

source_sentence: 於是魔波旬，便作是念：「此沙門亦不知不見，而作此言：『汝，波旬！
translation: Māra Pāpīyān then had this thought, That monk also didn't know or see it and said, 'You, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 汝，波旬！
translation: You, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 莫觸嬈如來及如來弟子，莫於長夜遭無量苦，無義饒益。』
translation: Don't touch the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciples, and don't experience measureless suffering for a long time; it doesn't make any sense to benefit them.'

source_sentence: 謂彼世尊，有如是力，如是有所能，彼世尊猶不能知我見我，況復弟子，
translation: That is to say, the World-honored One has such powers and such abilities. The World-honored One would not know or see me, much less his disciples.

source_sentence: 能知能見？
translation: Can you know and see?

source_sentence: 是事不然！」
translation: That's not the case!

source_sentence: 「汝波旬！
translation: You, Upagupta!

source_sentence: 汝所念，我亦知之。
translation: Whatever thoughts you have, I also know them.

source_sentence: 汝所作念：『沙門不知不見，而作此言：「波旬！
translation: You think, 'The ascetic doesn't know and doesn't see, but says this, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 波旬！
translation: Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 莫觸嬈如來及如來弟子，莫於長夜遭無量苦，無義饒益。」
translation: Don't touch the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciples, and don't experience measureless suffering for a long time; it doesn't make any sense to benefit them.

source_sentence: 謂彼世尊，有如是力，如是有所能，彼猶不能知我見我，況復弟子，能知見我？
translation: It means that the Bhagavān has such powers and such abilities, but he still can't know self or see self, so why wouldn't a disciple know and see self?

source_sentence: 是事不然！』」
translation: That's not the case!'

source_sentence: 於是魔波旬，復作是念：「此沙門為知見我，而作此言：『汝，波旬！
translation: Māra Pāpīyān then had another thought, This ascetic knew that he saw me and said, 'You, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 汝，波旬！
translation: You, Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 出！
translation: Come out!

source_sentence: 莫觸嬈如來及如來弟子，莫於長夜遭無量苦，無義饒益。』」
translation: Don't touch the Tathāgata or the Tathāgata's disciples, and don't suffer measureless pain for a long time; it doesn't make any sense to benefit them.'

source_sentence: 於是魔波旬，即從尊者大目乾連口中出，便在前立。
translation: Māra Pāpīyān then emerged from the mouth of Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana and stood in front of him.

source_sentence: 彼魔波旬，却住一面已，尊者大目乾連，告波旬曰：「波旬！
translation: After Māra Pāpīyān had stood to one side, Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana told Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 昔過去世有如來，名拘樓孫無所著、等正覺。
translation: In a past life, there was a Tathāgata named Krakucchanda, free from attachment and fully awakened.

source_sentence: 我在彼時，亦為觸嬈魔。
translation: When I was there, I also disturbed Māra.

source_sentence: 我有妹名迦羅，汝是彼子。
translation: I have a younger sister named Kālā, and you are her child.

source_sentence: 汝波旬！
translation: You, Upagupta!

source_sentence: 當以此知，汝是我妹子。
translation: Because of this, you should know that you are my younger sister.

source_sentence: 彼拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺，魔波旬有弟子，名毗樓(音聲)薩若，
translation: That Krakucchanda Tathāgata, free from attachment and fully awakened, Māra Pāpīyān had a disciple named Virūḍhaka (pronounced as Sarvāstivāda),

source_sentence: 最上最賢，勝諸弟子。
translation: He was the highest and most virtuous, surpassing all his disciples.

source_sentence: 何以故，波旬而令尊者毗樓，字為毗樓薩若？
translation: Why did Pāpīyān cause Venerable Virūḍhaka, whose name was Virūḍhaka?

source_sentence: 波旬！
translation: Pāpīyān!

source_sentence: 此尊者毗樓者，住梵天上，能以音聲，滿千世界，無有弟子與此等者、與聲等者，
translation: This venerable Vimalakīrti, who lives in the Brahma heavens, can fill a thousand worlds with his voice. There is no disciple who can equal this or any other such [qualities].

source_sentence: 無相似者，謂能說法。
translation: The absence of similarity refers to being able to teach the Dharma.

source_sentence: 此波旬以是故，而令尊者毗樓，名曰毗樓薩若。
translation: Because of this, Pāpīyān caused Venerable Virūḍhaka, whose name was Virūpāsaṃjñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 此波旬以何方便，令彼名薩若字曰薩若？
translation: What method did this Pāpīyān use to make them be called sarvajña and the word sarvajña?

source_sentence: 此波旬名薩若者，彼依村城住，早起著衣服持衣鉢，詣村城乞食，自護其身，
translation: This pāpīyān is called a sarvāstivāda because he relies on the villages and cities where he lives. He rises early in the morning, puts on his clothes, takes his robe and bowl, goes to the villages and cities to solicit

source_sentence: 諸根具足，意念常定。
translation: Their faculties are endowed, and their thought is always concentrated.

source_sentence: 彼詣村城乞食已，中後而還，舉衣鉢澡浴其足，舉尼師壇，著右肩上，
translation: After going to the village and towns to solicit alms food, he returned in the middle of the day. He bathed his feet with his robe and bowl [and] raised the nun’s altar on his right shoulder.

source_sentence: 若至靜處、若至樹下、若至空處，依敷尼師壇，結跏趺坐，輕舉速疾，
translation: If he reaches a quiet place, goes to a tree or an empty spot, spreads out his sitting mat and sits cross-legged on it, lifting it lightly and quickly.

source_sentence: 入想知滅正受。
translation: He enters into perception and knows the right feeling of cessation.

source_sentence: 彼中牧羊人，若見牧牛人，或擔薪人，或行路人，若見彼速疾入想知滅正受，
translation: If a sheepherd sees a cowherd, a loader of firewood, or a pedestrian on the road, and if he sees someone who quickly enters into perception, knows cessation, and correctly experiences it,

source_sentence: 見已作是念：『此沙門，坐此靜處今命終，我等寧可以乾草木牛糞，若敷碎草木，
translation: Having seen him, they thought: While this śramaṇa is seated in this quiet place, now that his life has come to an end, how could we dry grass, wood, cow dung, or blades of grass and trees?

source_sentence: 積覆其身，然火當還。』
translation: They accumulate it to cover their bodies, but the fire will return.'

source_sentence: 彼牧羊人、牧牛人、擔薪人、行路人，以乾草木，若敷碎草木，積覆其身，
translation: That sheepherd, cattleherd, loader of firewood, or traveler on the roads covered their bodies with dry grass and trees.

source_sentence: 然火已，離而還。
translation: After the fire had gone out, however, he departed and returned.

source_sentence: 於是尊者薩若，過夜已從三昧起，輕舉速疾收拭其衣，依城村住。
translation: After the night passed, Venerable Sāriputta rose from his samādhi, lifted it lightly, quickly removed its robes, and stayed in a city or village.

source_sentence: 彼晨起著衣服，與衣鉢俱，詣城村乞食，自能護身，具足諸根，意念常定。
translation: In the morning, he got up, put on his clothes, took his robe and bowl with him, went to the towns and villages to solicit alms, protected himself, had all his faculties perfected, and was always concentrated in mindfulness.

source_sentence: 若彼所見，牧羊人、牧牛人、擔薪人、行路人，見已作是念：『此沙門在他靜處而命終，
translation: If they see a sheepherd, an oxherding cowherd, a loader of firewood, or a traveler on the road, they think:

source_sentence: 我等以乾草木牛糞，若敷碎草木，積覆其身，然火已離而還。
translation: We covered our bodies with dry grass, trees, and cow dung. If we spread it on the ground or crushed pieces of grass and trees, it would cover them all over us. But when the fire had gone out, we returned home.

source_sentence: 而今此尊者，還復命存。』
translation: Now, this venerable one will return to life.'

source_sentence: 此波旬，以是方便故，名為薩若，字曰薩若(還生)。
translation: Because of this skillful means, this Pāpīyān is called a sarvajña, which is called sarvajña (returning to birth).

source_sentence: 「於是度數(弊也)簸提旬(惡也常波)作是念：『此剃頭沙門，以黑纏形，
translation: 「於是度數(弊也)簸提旬(惡也常波)作是念,『此剃頭沙門修行門以黑纏形,

source_sentence: 彼與禪俱，與禪相應，常行於禪。
translation: They're associated with meditation, are associated with meditation, and always practice meditation.

source_sentence: 猶若驢常荷擔，繫在櫪上，或不得麥，禪而禪，與禪相應，常行於禪。
translation: It's like a donkey that always carries a burden and is tied up in a pile of millet or doesn't get wheat, meditates while meditating, and always practices meditation when associated with meditation.

source_sentence: 如是剃頭沙門，以黑纏形，或與禪俱，與禪相應，行禪。
translation: Thus, a shaved-headed ascetic takes the form of a black enveloper or is accompanied by meditation, which is associated with meditation and practices meditation.

source_sentence: 猶若猫子，在於鼠穴前，而欲捕鼠在中，禪而禪，與禪相應，行於禪。
translation: It's like a cat that's in front of a rat's den and wants to catch a rat in it, meditates and meditates, practices meditation associated with meditation, and goes into meditation.

source_sentence: 如是此剃頭沙門，以黑纏形，常與禪俱，與禪相應，常行禪。
translation: Thus, this shaved-headed ascetic is always accompanied by meditation in the form of a black enveloper, always practicing meditation associated with it.

source_sentence: 猶若鵂狐在空牆上，在中捕鼠，禪而禪，與禪相應，常行禪。
translation: It's like a fox on an empty wall that catches a rat while it's there, meditates and meditates, associates with meditation, and always practices meditation.

source_sentence: 如是此剃頭沙門，以黑纏形，常與禪俱，與禪相應，常行禪。
translation: Thus, this shaved-headed ascetic is always accompanied by meditation in the form of a black enveloper, always practicing meditation associated with it.

source_sentence: 猶若鵁在水岸上，伺魚於中，禪而禪。
translation: It's like when a turtle is on the shore of water and waits for a fish to be there, meditating and meditating.

source_sentence: 如是此剃頭沙門，以黑纏形，與禪相應，禪而禪。
translation: Thus, this shaved-headed ascetic takes the form of a black enveloper that's associated with meditation and meditates while he's in meditation.

source_sentence: 此云何名為禪？
translation: What's called meditation?

source_sentence: 為何所禪？
translation: What's the meditation?

source_sentence: 為是何禪？
translation: What's this dhyāna?

source_sentence: 或亂或忘或不定，我亦不見來，亦不見去，亦不見住，亦不見終，亦不見生，
translation: They may be confused, forgetful, or indeterminate. Neither do I see the coming nor the going, and neither do I see the abiding; neither do I see the end nor the birth.

source_sentence: 我寧可為婆羅門居士說。
translation: I'd better explain it for the Brāhmaṇa householder.

source_sentence: 如是此沙門，精進當罵之，當打，當說非，當恚之，若少多罵打，瞋恚說其非。
translation: Thus, this ascetic should be verbally abused, beaten, and said to be “wrong.” He should be scolded. If he is verbally abused even a little bit, then with anger he will be accused of being wrong.

source_sentence: 若意有異者，此惡魔求其便、索其便，或得其便，或得其因緣。』
translation: If there's a difference in mind, this bad demon asks for an advantage or asks for an advantage, or gets an advantage, or gets the causes and conditions for it.'

source_sentence: 此魔波旬為弊魔，而向婆羅門居士：『彼沙門精進，當罵之說其非，當瞋恚之。
translation: Because Māra Pāpīyān was a bad demon, he addressed the Brāhmaṇa householder, saying to him, 'That ascetic's diligent, you must scold him and tell him what's wrong, and you must angrily

source_sentence: 彼精進沙門，當以木打之，當以石擲，或以杖撾，或破彼精進沙門頭，
translation: That diligent renunciant should beat him with wood, toss him with a stone, or chastise him with a stick, or break off the head of that diligent renunciant.

source_sentence: 或裂衣壞鉢。』
translation: Perhaps they'll split their robes and break their bowls.'

source_sentence: 謂彼時婆羅門居士命終，彼因彼緣，身壞死，生惡趣泥犁中。
translation: It means that when the Brāhmaṇa householder's life ended, he was born in a bad destiny in a mud plow when his body broke up and died because of that condition.

source_sentence: 生彼已，作是念：『今已受此苦，更或能復劇是處，而我於精進沙門，
translation: Having been born there, he thinks: Now that I am subject to this kind of suffering, perhaps I will be able to experience it again.

source_sentence: 發於邪。』
translation: They give rise to error.'

source_sentence: 「於是波旬，取拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺弟子，破其頭，壞其鉢，
translation: “Thereupon, Pāpīyān took the Tathāgata Kauṇḍinya, a disciple of the perfectly enlightened one who had no attachment or attachment, and broke his head and destroyed his bowl.

source_sentence: 裂其衣，便往至拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺所。
translation: He cut off his robes and went to the place where Krakucchanda Tathāgata, free from attachment and fully awakened, was staying.

source_sentence: 「彼時拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺，在無量百千眾前圍遶，而為說法。
translation: “Then the Tathāgata Krakucchanda, free from attachment and fully awakened, surrounded by measureless hundreds of thousands of people, taught the Dharma to them.

source_sentence: 拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺，遙見弟子，頭被打破，衣鉢被裂，從遠而來。
translation: Krakucchanda Tathāgata, free from attachment and fully awakened, saw the disciple coming from a distance with his head broken off and his robe and bowl torn apart.

source_sentence: 見已告諸比丘：『汝諸比丘！
translation: After seeing them, he told the monks, 'You monks!

source_sentence: 當見此比丘，為弊魔向婆羅門居士說：「汝當取精進沙門，罵之撾打，
translation: Seeing this monk, the evil Māra said to the brahman householder, “Take this diligent renunciant and scold him.

source_sentence: 當瞋恚少多撾打，瞋恚意或能有若干。」
translation: You'll be angry and often beaten with little anger, and there may be a certain amount of anger in your mind.

source_sentence: 而此弊魔，求其便，索其因緣，求其因緣，得其因緣。
translation: Yet this evil demon seeks to get an advantage over them, asks about their causes and conditions, investigates their causes and conditions, and obtains their causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 汝諸比丘！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 當與慈俱滿一方已正受住，如是二三四上下一切諸方意與慈俱，無怨無二無恚，
translation: They should be accompanied by kindness in one direction and have been correctly received and abiding. In this way, the minds of two, three, four, and five are accompanied by kindness in all directions; there is no enm

source_sentence: 極廣極大，無量極分別，滿一切諸方已正受住。
translation: They are extremely vast, extremely great, immeasurable, and extremely discriminating, filling all directions with the abode of right reception.

source_sentence: 如是，意與悲、喜、護俱，滿一切諸方已正受住，當令弊魔求其便，索其因緣，
translation: Thus, when the mind is accompanied by compassion, joy, and protection, it fills all directions with right reception and abiding, causing that bad demon to seek its way and ask for its causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 不得其便，不得其因緣。』
translation: They won't get an opportunity, and they won't get a cause or condition.'

source_sentence: 於是波旬，向拘樓孫如來、無所著、等正覺弟子，說如此言：『彼與慈俱，
translation: Then Pāpīyān said to the Tathāgata Krakucchanda, the disciple of the perfectly enlightened one who was free from attachment and fully awakened, “He is accompanied by compassion.

source_sentence: 滿一方已正受住，如是二三四上下一切諸方意與慈俱，無怨無二無恚，
translation: Having fulfilled one direction, he’s correctly received and abiding there. In this way, two, three, four, and five are combined with kindness in the minds of all directions, without enmity, without duality, without hatred.

source_sentence: 極廣極大，無量極分別，滿諸方已正受住。
translation: They are extremely vast and great, immeasurable and extremely discriminating, filling all directions with the abode of right reception.

source_sentence: 如是，意與悲、喜、護俱，滿一切諸方已正受住。
translation: Thus, when the mind is accompanied by compassion, joy, and protection, it fills all directions and correctly receives and abides.

source_sentence: 謂彼惡魔求其便，索其因緣，不能得其便，不能得其因緣。』
translation: It means that bad demons seek their opportunity and ask for its causes and conditions, but they can't get an opportunity or obtain its causes and conditions.'

source_sentence: 於是波旬弊魔作是念：『我以此方便，不能得此沙門便，不能得此沙門其因緣，
translation: Then the Evil One Pāpīyān thought to himself, “Through these expedient means I am unable to get an advantage over this śramaṇa.

source_sentence: 我寧可向婆羅門居士說：「汝當取此精進沙門，當恭敬承事禮事供養。」
translation: I'd better say to the Brāhmaṇa householder, Take this diligent ascetic and venerate, serve, bow, and make offerings to him.

source_sentence: 少多供養承事禮事已，若意有異，而彼弊魔，求其便、索其便，索其因緣，
translation: If there is a difference of opinion, the evil Māra seeks an advantage over them, asks for an advantage over them, and ascertains their causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 得其便，得其因緣。』
translation: Attaining their opportunity, they attain their causes and conditions.'

source_sentence: 此弊魔波旬，向居士婆羅門說：『彼精進沙門！
translation: This bad demon Pāpīyān said to the householder Brāhmaṇa, 'That diligent ascetic!

source_sentence: 當供養，當承事禮事。』
translation: You should make offerings, serve and venerate them.'

source_sentence: 令婆羅門居士，脫衣敷地，而作是言：『令此精進沙門，當蹈上行，精進沙門當遊上行。
translation: He ordered the Brāhmaṇa householder to remove his robes and spread them on the ground and said, 'Let this diligent ascetic go upward, and that diligent ascetic will go upward.'

source_sentence: 此精進沙門，為極苦行，當令我等於長夜得義饒益。』
translation: This diligent ascetic is an extremely painful practice that will cause us to attain meaning and benefit for a long time.'

source_sentence: 令婆羅門居士，自洗其髮，以敷著地，而作是言：『精進沙門！
translation: He ordered the Brāhmaṇa householder to wash himself, spread his clothes on the ground, and said, 'Sir, diligent ascetic!

source_sentence: 當蹈上行。
translation: He'll follow the higher path.
